intro: Alepidea comosa, commonly known as the woolly alepidea, is a flowering plant native to South Africa. It belongs to the Amaryllis family (Amaryllidaceae) and is characterized by its dense, woolly foliage and striking, tubular flowers. The plant typically grows in rocky, well-drained soils and thrives in full sun. Its flowers, which range in color from white to pink, bloom in late spring to early summer. Alepidea comosa is often cultivated for its ornamental value and is relatively easy to care for in suitable climates.
